alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 09 at 2:35PM EDT until June 09 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: The National Weather Service in Miami has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Miami-Dade County in southeastern Florida... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 235 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Homestead, Coral Gables, Black Point, Kendall, The Redland, Pinecrest, Goulds, Cutler Bay, Princeton, West Perrine, Homestead Base, Naranja, Zoo Miami, Palmetto Bay, Richmond Heights, Richmond West, Leisure City, South Miami Heights, Palmetto Estates and Howard. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
